block.p: Jessica Ruen Young, a daughter of Dr. Kathryn Taaffe McLearn of Riverside, Conn., and Dr. J. Gerald Young of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Page Naftel, the son of Jane Head Johnson and Dr. Robert S. Naftel, both of Birmingham, Ala. The Rev. Robert Taylor performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Riverside, Conn.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Vanderbilt University, where they met.

Jessica Ruen Young, a daughter of Dr. Kathryn Taaffe McLearn of Riverside, Conn., and Dr. J. Gerald Young of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Page Naftel, the son of Jane Head Johnson and Dr. Robert S. Naftel, both of Birmingham, Ala. The Rev. Robert Taylor performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Riverside, Conn.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Vanderbilt University, where they met.

Mrs. Naftel, 25, is a senior consultant in Atlanta, specializing in computer systems, for Deloitte Consulting. Her father is a psychiatrist in New York and a professor of psychiatry at New York University. Her mother is an assistant vice president at the Commonwealth Fund, a private foundation in New York that aims to improve health care and health insurance. The bride's mother is also a member of the executive board of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists.

Mr. Naftel, 27, is known as Page. He is a sales manager at Ram Tool and Supply, a retail store in Atlanta. His mother is a counselor at the Oasis Women's Center in Birmingham. His father is a senior partner in the Birmingham Radiology Group.
